dt: {bc}the basic unit in society traditionally consisting of two parents rearing their children
{bc}any of various social units differing from but regarded as equivalent to the traditional family

dt.t: want to spend more time with my {wi}family{/wi}

dt: {bc}a group of individuals living under one roof and usually under one head {bc}{sx|household||}
{bc}a people or group of peoples regarded as deriving from a common stock
{bc}a group of people united by certain convictions or a common {d_link|affiliation|affiliate:1} {bc}{sx|fellowship||}
{bc}the staff of a high official (such as the President)
{bc}a group of things related by common characteristics: such as
{bc}a closely related series of elements or chemical compounds

{bc}a group of soils with similar chemical and physical properties (such as texture, pH, and mineral content) that comprise a category ranking above the series and below the subgroup in soil {d_link|classification|classification}
{bc}a group of related languages descended from a single ancestral language
{bc}a group of {d_link|related|related} plants or animals forming a category ranking above a genus and below an order and usually comprising several to many genera
{bc}the {d_link|descendants|descendant:2} or line of a particular individual especially of some outstanding female
{bc}a set of curves or surfaces whose equations differ only in parameters
{bc}a unit of a crime syndicate (such as the Mafia) operating within a geographical area

quotes.t: The disappearance of decent-paying low-skilled jobs over the last 30 years makes it virtually impossible for a young high-school dropout to successfully support a {qword}family{/qword} on a legitimate income.
Nobody ever came to the farm—through "the big gate," a mile off on the pike—except kin and a {qword}family{/qword} named Rawls: a widow with two daughters and a son, my only playmate.
It was quite an understood thing in the {qword}family{/qword} that Lord Fawn must marry money.
A defendant in a racketeering trial was described yesterday as a Mafia captain who had carried out a plot to kill three rivals in the Bonanno crime {qword}family{/qword}.

et: Middle English {it}familie{/it}, from Latin {it}familia{/it} household (including servants as well as kin of the householder), from {it}famulus{/it} servant
shortdef: the basic unit in society traditionally consisting of two parents rearing their children; also : any of various social units differing from but regarded as equivalent to the traditional family
a group of individuals living under one roof and usually under one head : household

dt: {bc}designed or suitable for both children and adults

shortdef: of or relating to a family
designed or suitable for both children and adults

dt: {bc}a large Bible usually having special pages for recording births, marriages, and deaths

shortdef: a large Bible usually having special pages for recording births, marriages, and deaths

dt: {bc}a doctor regularly consulted by a family

shortdef: a doctor regularly consulted by a family

dt: {bc}a usually unpaid leave of absence for an employee to attend to family concerns (such as a serious illness or the care of an infant)

shortdef: a usually unpaid leave of absence for an employee to attend to family concerns (such as a serious illness or the care of an infant)

dt: {bc}a man with a spouse and child or children dependent on him

shortdef: a man with a spouse and child or children dependent on him; especially : a man devoted to his family
a doctor specializing in family practice —called also family doctor
